  • Method Details

    • factory

      static <P> Params4JFactory<P> factory()
      Factory method for creating a Params4J builder.
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of the parameters object.
      Returns:
      A newly created Params4JFactory<P>

    • gatherParameters

      P gatherParameters()
      Gather parameters from all the configured ParameterGatherers and return a single P object.
      Returns:
      A P object filled with values found by all the configured ParameterGatherers.

    • notifyOfChanges

      boolean notifyOfChanges(Consumer<P> handler)
      Start the monitor for any dynamic changes to parameters whilst the system is running. Note that this may be called when no actual change has been made to the P object.
      Parameters:
      handler - Callback that will be called with a newly created P object when things might have changed.
      Returns:
      True if any of the configured ParameterGatherers support notifications.

    • getDocumentation

      List<ConfigurationProperty> getDocumentation(P defaultInstance, String prefix, List<Pattern> terminalClasses, List<Pattern> undocumentedClasses)
      Return a set of documentation for the properties that can be set in a Parameters class.The documentation values are determined in the following order:
      1. Comment annotations.
      2. First line of the Javadoc as captured by the JavadocCapturer.
      The two lists of regular expressions are both compared against the canonicalName of the setter property. Terminal classes are those, like LocalDateTime, or File that can be set from a single String value and that do not need to be traversed further. Undocumented classes are those, like Vertx Config, that are massive POJOs of properties that this compilation unit does not know about. When presenting undocumented classes to the user they should be listed with the javadoc URL for these classes (which is not known here).
      Parameters:
      defaultInstance - An instance of the class to be examined, preloaded with default values.
      prefix - The prefix to be prepended to any determined property names to match the prefix specified in (for example) the CommandLineArgumentsGatherer.
      terminalClasses - List of regular expressions used to identify properties that are of terminal types - if the class is terminal it should be settable by Jackson from a single string value.
      undocumentedClasses - List of regular expressions used to identify properties that are of undocumented types - if the class is undocumented it will not be traversed further despite not being settable by Jackson.
      Returns:
      A list of properties that can be set.
